dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A comet crosses the sky. Stunning mountain landscape. Tiny stone houses spread alo the mountain slope. Gardens and orchards of the village houses, with the trees in bloom. Spring. Birds are chirpi sheep bleating, dogs barking. Caption: SPRING 1914 South East Albania The comet crosses the sky. Movie title:

dialogues.speaker: A DARK YEAR
dialogues.text: based on the novel “Viti i Mbrapshté” by Ismail Kadare dissolve / credits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village café with three tables on the outside. Only m dressed up in traditional costume and carrying guns can b seen. These are Shestan Verdha, Cute Benja, Tod Allamani, Alush Gjati. The other men, who aren’t as well dressed as first, are following the conversation. The four friends d raki and smoke their tobacco. Everyone is looking up at t comet in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ALUSH
dialogues.text: Where you think it’s going to fall?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ALUSH
dialogues.text: The comet. Nobody answers.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: I wish it could fall on England, on London I wish it could fall. So that those border maps of the Balkans could burn down to ashes.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Stop talking nonsense, Cute; it’s not going to fall anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Then what is it doing up there? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Just coming round and round.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Round and round, just like us here: leave home to come to the café, and then leave the café to go back home...

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Don’t you ever stop? Doské Mokrari enters the café, with an elongated pumpkin hand.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: This is how the comet looks: like a pumpkin. He pulls out a knife, cuts the pumpkin in half and throws seeds on the table. He shouts. DOSKE (cont’d) Get up, you morons; let’s go and save Albania, because she is in such an horrible mess already... And you have time to waste with that harlot up there in the sky?... Cute Benja is the most nervous of them all. He hits the ground with his tufted green-hide shoe. The chicken scatt away. Dust is raised. With a short stick he draws a line around his foot, something like a_ map.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Here you are! I draw a line around my foot, and what do I get? I get Albania. She’s no bigger than this tufted shoe of mine.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Listen here: even the Queen of England and the King of France know that Albania is here. They say they have lost the state seals, they have lost the maps, and the borders are nowhere to be found: nobody’s got a clue how to get them back. And you know why? Because the Greek pulls the rope on his side, and the Albanian pulls the rope on his side, and then here comes somebody else - say a Serb or a Macedonian - and does away with the markers at night. Then what’s next is that everybody going to pull out their guns, and it’s damn over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2  The men nod.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, wait a minute. You want to drive me insane? How come this border issue is so hard to figure out? Wherever you have Albanians that’s where the borders should be traced. No more Albanians, the land isn’t ours. Everyone nods approvingly. Cute (cont'd) Do you really think this land is starving for a king so much that they took the trouble to order us one in Europe? What do you make of it?

dialogues.speaker: ALUSH
dialogues.text: That this country is starving for a king, dammit! The men laugh. Shestan Verdha, a handsome man, thoughtful. He rolls a cigarette and puts it be s.2 p.3. keeps silent, tween his lips. Finally, Shestan stands and talks to them.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: I say, tomorrow we leave for battle. There’s nothing worth waiting for. The village isn’t going anywhere, the women will take care of the farming. Who’s coming along?

dialogues.speaker: ALUSH
dialogues.text: Battle? What battle? Who are we fighting against? Silence. They all look at Shestan.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What we are fighting for, you mean.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Let’s leave first, and then play it by ear. There’s nothing to be done here anyway. All we do is sit in this café and talk. Let’s not waste any more time. We’ve got guns and bullets ready. Count me in, captain.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Captain? I didn’t say I was the captain. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Well, you should be. Where would we get someone better? Cute Benja stands up and approaches Shestan. CUTE (cont’d) I am all for battle, captain. If we don’t do it now, when are we going to fight for Albania? We’re fed up with words... They all stay solemnly silent.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: We are going to fight for the German king. He is coming here to teach us how to become Europeans. Isn’t this good enough to fight for? They all nod, although Shestan’s words catch them a bit o guard. EXT. SHESTAN’S HOUSE. DAWN. 3 The sun appears over the mountain top. Smoke is coming ou the house chimneys in the village. Shestan washes himself with spring water in the garden of his house. His mother looks sad. SHESTAN’S MOTHER You are such a sweet pretty boy! You have to get married as soon as you come back. Shestan hides his smile in his towel. SHESTAN’S MOTHER (cont’d) Did you hear what I just said? You should get married and have kids. It’s a shame to stay single. Everyone in the village is talking about this.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, mother, I’1ll get married when I come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roosters are crowing and dogs are barking in the village. Shestan Verdha meets his four friends Doské, Tod, Alush, and Cute. They are all dressed up handsomely, with their tight suits and their kilts. Their weapons glisten clean. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4  s.4 p.5. Women and kids follow them to see them off. Shestan’s mot wipes off her tears with her black scarf, as the other la wail, stuck together like cattle. Tod’s wife cries a rive

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: Those who want to cry, can do so when we’re gone. We don’t want to hear any crying here. Stop it, okay? Tod’s wife tries to choke her crying off. The men say goo bye to their relatives and friends, and set off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun in shoulder, and food bags on their back, the men lea the village. Suddenly Doské stops as if he remembered something. He pulls off the gun from his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Where are we going, without a map?!

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What do we need a map for, Doské? It’s going to mess us up! Shestan is waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: No way, captain. We can’t go nowhere without a map. Not serious you know? The map shows the roads, shows the state with its borders and its borders show the state. That’s the way it is. They go back to the village. EXT. VILLAGE CHIEF’S HOUSE. MORNING. 6 A leashed dog in the garden barks angrily. Doské knocks a the main door.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE CHIEF
dialogues.text: (off screen) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Hey Chief, open the door, we need the map! The village chief opens the door with a puffy face. His w pops up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE CHIEF
dialogues.text: Who the hell do you think you are? I don’t give no map to nobody! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5  s.6 p.6. Shestan pulls a gun to the man’s head.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: It’s war time, you idiot, don’t you get it? Give us the map!

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE CHIEF
dialogues.text: What war is that?

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: It’s just war - war, you asshole! Doské feels the mayor until he finds the key to the desk attached to his pants, then goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: It's a war for freedom. You get it? Freedom, you remember? he offended village chief starts mumbling. Doské soon com ack with a roll of paper. oH4

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE CHIEF
dialogues.text: May you never come back! They turn their backs on him and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at all the signs, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: How should I know? Shestan produces the old map of the Ottoman Empire, that doesn’t show the borders of the new Albanian state. Every gathers around the map. Cute points at something. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: There, captain; this is where we are.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? This one here is Greece, it says “Toannina”.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Sorry, captain. what do I know, I can’t even read!

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Then why don’t you just shut up and listen to me. OK.. Where the heck are we? He points his finger at a line on the map, then rolls the and puts it in his bag. SHESTAN (cont’d) We go walk down this river which flows to the sea, that is west. Do you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters are being photographed in front of a mule an canon. They fight with each other for a place in the fron row. Keep switching places over and over, until Sotir, th old photographer, already annoyed and somewhat impatient beckons them with his hand and inserts his head behind th camera’s black cloth. Cute Benja tries to switch place again in order to get in front of the tall Shestan. The head of Sotir shows up fro behind the black cloth.

dialogues.speaker: SOTIR
dialogues.text: Can’t do it like that! Can’t do it! Please, freeze!

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with you? Have you got a gnat in your ass? Just shoot the damn photo! They all cackle. Sotir hides his head again and shoots. T image freezes, and shows the fighters laughing in their beautiful attire. Cute Benja is shown smoothing off his moustache, Shestan is in the middle and Doské is smiling, looking at his captain.  10 s.9 p.8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunny day. A plateau in Central Albania. In the distance, stunning mountain range. The fighters, gathered around Shestan, listen carefully to his tentative reading from a half-torn Albanian newspaper. It shows a photo of the kin Von Wied, his wife Sophia Schomburg and some officials in Tirana.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: (voice over) "The German prince Wilhelm Wied arrives in Durrés. He has been appointed King of Albanians, by the Great Powers." Shestan looks at his friends. SHESTAN (cont’d) "Wilhelm Wied was received today by a crowd of hundreds of Muslim, Catholic and Orthodox Albanians, who welcomed their new King." Silence.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Can you believe this?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Well, now it’s too late to do anything. It’s our fault too, because we weren’t able to come up with a king ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: What’s the big deal with this king?! Is it because he’s a foreigner? Do you know that even the Greeks used to have a German king for more than thirty years, not to mention the Bulgarians? Cute keeps looking at the photos on the paper.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Ain’t worth nothing these newspapers, captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of Cam refugees (Albanians expelled from Northern Greece) and Jews (banned from Thessalonica): men, women a kids, with their carts, horses and a truck as well, comin the opposite direction of Shestan’s detachment with their mule and canon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Any fighting where you’re coming from? The Jews don’t understand. Doské gestures. DOSKE (cont’d) Fighting ! War ?!

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, they don’t seem to get it. Did you see any fighting...?

dialogues.speaker: JEW 1
dialogues.text: Thessalonica, Helada...

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: These are Greeks, did you hear that? They don’t speak Albanian, they are Jews from Thessalonica.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: No, no, what are you talking about? We’re no Greek, we’re Cam. He says something in Greek as well.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, man. I took you for a Greek. Where are you heading to?

dialogues.speaker: JEW 1
dialogues.text: We fled from Thessalonica to come here; they told us nobody will do us any harm. The Cam translates.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: He says they’ve fled Thessalonica to come to Albania, because nobody will ever touch them here. In Caméria, that was some carnage. They slew our sons, took our land and our cattle away from us, and then sent the police to chase us away. God only knows what will become of us. For them it’s even worse: they’ve been chased out from every place.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Why did you leave? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JEW 1
dialogues.text: Massacre. They came at night to kill and ransack us. The Cam translates from Greek

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: He speaks of massacre, they came at night to kill and ransack them.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: And where are you heading to now, you poor people?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: We don’t know. All we need is a piece of land, to get some shelter. These Jews are going to Elbasan. They say they have some friends there. At least they have some gold on them to survive. How far is it to Elbasan?

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Two-days walk. Doské approaches Shestan and whispers in his ear. DOSKE (cont’d) Let’s take their gold, captain. We’ve got a war to fight, damn it

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Enough, Doské. We’re not here to rob people. These are people, like us

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Have a safe trip. And hurry up, so that night won’t catch you on the road. One of the Jews starts shouting in Greek.

dialogues.speaker: JEW 2
dialogues.text: No gasoline left! I told you not to take it! He inserts a stick in the fuel tank and takes it out. It dry, nothing’s left. Shestan’s detachment sets off with c and mule, while the Cams and Jews unload stuff from the t and divide it among the horses. 10  14 s.11 p.11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five-fighter detachment walks by a hamlet half hidden smoke. They see people cutting grass with sickles and bur it in heaps.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Captain, these are Albanians that’s for sure.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Look at their faces, withered up under the sun.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Cute, do not insult us Albanians.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: This is true, that’s how we look. That’s what the Sun does, dry up the skin.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Enough, you two! The fighters approach with great caution, holding their weapons ready. The peasants quit working and greet them.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Do you happen to know where there is fighting going on? The peasants shake their heads. They mumble something, ta to each other, then one of them nods.

dialogues.speaker: PEASANT
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, I know. In the East. You see these mountains, over there ? Shestan and his men look at the ridge the man is pointing PEASANT (cont’d) You have to climb this mountain here: it’s a shortcut - if you go around it, be too long. You see the pass? When you’1l be on the other side, you’1l see a plain. It’s not there. Shestan and his men exchange a puzzled look. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11  12 s.11 p.12. PEASANT (cont’d) In the distance, on the other side of that plain, you will see a second mountain. As you go through the pass of this second mountain you’1l see another plain, with a river. That’s where the slaughtering is taking place, on both banks. Two more fighters join Shestan’s group

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s raining. An old ottoman bridge, long and narrow, thr on a gigantic arch. The fighters stop to let pass two peo First is a man over sixty, with his traditional Albanian suit, comfortably sitting on his horse, and protecting himself from the rain with a big black umbrella. Behind h young woman follows on foot, dressed in fancy-colored clothes, dripping under the rain. She wears a cross aroun her neck. The men greet each other, hands on their hearts

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Have you heard anything about any fighting, old man?

dialogues.speaker: HORSE RIDER
dialogues.text: Fighting?! No fighting here. In the South, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What South? South is where we come from. The man on the horse motions the girl to move, so that sh not too close to the men. Shestan stares at the girl. She looks back, blushing. The old man seems to get confused. Shestan keeps staring at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Where do you come from?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: Our village is one day’s walk from here.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: And she, who is she? He shows the girl. The man on the horse doesn’t seem to l this question.

dialogues.speaker: HORSE RIDER
dialogues.text: She is my daughter. Why do you ask? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12  s.12 p.13. Cute laughs out loud. Doské nudges him.Shestan looks at t beautiful girl with her dripping clothes, then at her fat comfortable and dry under his umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: I am taking my daughter to the nuns.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: I just asked you “Why?”. It’s war. It could be dangerous. The old man is sweating fear.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: The country’s back with the Turkish Sultan, that’s why. My daughter will be safe with the nuns. They’11 give her food and shelter. Then, I won’t even have to worry about the dowry and the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: The Sultan’s armies are coming! Our wives and daughters, they’1l have to cover their faces! The fighters don’t buy what the man says.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Don’t lie to us, it doesn’t suit your moustache.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: My moustache’s none of your business, sir!

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Yes it is! And Albania has no business with Turkey whatsoever The empire’s dead, it’s history. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: Don’t you understand, you fool? The Turkish Sultan is coming! It’s in the papers. It’s over, go home! Shestan comes nearer to Agnes’ father and talks coldly, pointing at the exhausted girl.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Get down! Let her ride the horse! The man looks scared, but he doesn’t budge. Shestan cocks rifle. Cute, Doské, Tod and Alush try to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Stop it, captain. Don’t get intoa blood feud. These people are Catholic. Their customs are harsh.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Quarreling over trifles, methinks. Shestan is unconvinced. The others try to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: I don’t care what he is. I know what I am doing. Get out of the way! He approaches Agnes’ father and waits for him to dismount SHESTAN (cont’d) Get off, and let the girl mount. She’s your daughter. The man falters, then gets off the horse with a frown. Shestan grabs the girl by her arm. Agnes tries to resist by evading his grip, but Shestan grasps her foot, and tri to place it on the stirrup. Motions her to get on the hor She doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Get on the horse, kid. It’s for your own good. Your daddy won’t say anything. Shestan looks at the girl, then at her father frozen in anger, and finally greets him, placing the palm of his ri hand over his heart. Agnes’ father coldly returns the greeting, then hits the horse with his stick. The horse j forward. Shestan can’t take his eyes off Agnes. Agnes sta back at Shestan. They are in love. Everyone has noticed h dazzled Shestan is.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: Move! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14  s.12 p.15. Agnes looks at Shestan’s beautiful eyes. Shestan’s eyes follow her, sadly. Cute shouts at Agnes’ father.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Sultan my ass, you fucking bastard! He raises the gun and gets ready to shoot, but Shestan doesn’t let him. Cute (cont'd) You must be out of your mind, old man! Locking up such a beauty, such a goddamn beauty! Poor girl! Shestan, through his binoculars, sees the Agnes turning towards him and trying to find out where he is. Ton Agnes’ father stops his horse and turns to his daughter. stays put, with her head down. He slaps her hard. Agnes h the ground. He yells at her

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: I am going to kill you! Right here, right now, with my own hands! You hear me? For Jesus, I swear I am going to kill you! Shame on you! With a trembling hand, he tries to light a wet cigarette. daughter follows him, with her head down. Ton Shestan puts his binoculars down, takes his gun and shoot little aside, to scare the father. The horse is startled, instead. The man on the horse hits the animal with his st The girl follows him, through the rain. She turns her hea where the shot came from. Sees only the shadow of Shestan standing afar on the bridge, smoking gun in hand. Ton Agnes and her father have stopped by the roadside. The ma gives hay to the soaked horse, while his daughter is hold the umbrella for him. He opens the food bag and motions A to help herself. She refuses, shaking her head. The man produces bread and some cheese, and starts eating.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: What? Agnes looks like she can’t find her words. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15  13 s.12 p.16. AGNES FATHER (cont’d) Eat. She doesn’t reply.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Dad, I don’t want to go there.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?! You have left home already. Everyone in the village knows you are going to become God’s daughter now. Agnes seems to be shocked by her father’s words.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Dad, are you telling me the truth?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: Of course, yes. Silence AGNES FATHER (cont'd) How is it that you don’t want to go there? That’s God’s house. Agnes insists, still shaking from the cold and emotion.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Father, why are you locking me up in that place? Her father hesitates, doesn’t look her in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: Where can I take you then daughter?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Home, dad. The father doesn’t answer. Agnes keeps her head lowered. man rolls a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big plains in Central Albania. Red rebel Flags with the Ottoman crescent can be seen waving all over the place wi the green muslim flag. Hundreds of peasant soldiers, some rags and others in uniforms of the former Turkish-Ottoman army are dancing and beating the drums and singing (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REBELS
dialogues.text: Give us our daddy! Give us our daddy! Long Live the Sultan! Long Live Albania! The dervishes and the mullahs pray and dance like lunatic Steam coming from the huge cauldrons as well as the sharp smell of meat being roasted over the fire are everywhere. Their chief, Kus Babaj, is showing off among them, wearin old Turkish general uniform. He prays, holding his hands joined in front of his face, and whispers paragraphs from Koran in a trance, making sure everyone sees he is prayin Excited dervishes try out their tricks with fire and kniv Shestan and his warriors stand hidden on the hilltop.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: You hear their new song? Nobody answers. DOSKE (cont’d) Those soldiers heads covered with the Turkish fez, beat their drums and shout:"We want our daddy, we want our daddy," that is, the Sultan. Then they sing: "We set off for paradise, but ended up in hell, Albania, you whore, you've poisoned us all." Cute seals Doské’s mouth with the palm of his hand. Doské tries to get away. The others try to get at Doské, they a angry.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Shame on you, Doské! How can you call Albania a whore? Could your mouth be cursed for ever! Doské pushes Cute’s hand away and raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: That’s not me, you jerk; these are Kus Babaj’s thugs! Are you deaf?

dialogues.speaker: ALUSH
dialogues.text: Doské, stop acting like a fool! How can you call your own land that way?! They are all standing up now, guns ready. Shestan gets in middle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: That’s what they sing, what do I know?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Even if they sing it, you don’t have to! What a shame, if anybody hears it! Doské is stunned. SHESTAN (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: Doské is silent. SHESTAN (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, OK... Doské starts to shout. DOSKE (cont’d) Long Live Albania, Long Live King Wied!

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Long Live Albania! SHESTAN’S MEN (all together) Long Live Albania, Long Live King Wied! No reaction from Kus Babajs’ camp. The drum beats covered their shouts. EXT. CONVENT’S GATE. DAY 14 The gate opens and Mother Superior appears. She greets Ag and her father. He has tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES FATHER
dialogues.text: I’m trusting you with my daughter. He crosses himself and then places the palm of his hand o his heart. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18  15 16 17 s.14 p.19. Mother Superior nods to him who is about to hug his daugh but a nun has already taken Agnes by the hand and led her inside. The man can barely hold his tears as the gate clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Superior motions to Agnes, a skinny nun.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: This is Rosseta. You will have a spare bed in the same room. She will show you to everything. Off you go! Rosseta, the Skinny Nun, bows slightly to Mother Superior goes. Agnes follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another nun is coarsely cutting Agnes’ hair with shears. Skinny Nun is watching. Agnes stares at the mops passing front of her eyes and falling on the floor. She looks distraught. The Skinny Nun is amused. The nun gives Agnes small mirror. She stares at her very short hair.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY NUN
dialogues.text: Go take a bath now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nuns are eating. Agnes stares at her soup, lost in thoughts. The Skinny Nun sitting next to her takes a piec bread and gives it to her.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY NUN
dialogues.text: Eat! Move your spoon! Agnes doesn’t react. Mother Superior looks at her. In sec all the nuns have stopped eating, and wait for Agnes to d something. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: Eat! All the nuns wait for Agnes to do something. Agnes understands she must eat. She fills her spoon with soup. she doesn’t feel like eating, she just stares at her spoo SILENCE. MOTHER SUPERIOR (cont'd) If you don’t want to eat, go to your room! We shall attend to you later on. Agnes leaves the refectory. Everyone starts eating again. There is a low whispering all around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19  18 s.17 p.20. MOTHER SUPERIOR (cont’d) Silence! The murmurs end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes is on her knees scrubbing the floor of the corridor with a brush and soap. She looks exhausted and sad. Mothe Superior comes and stands in front of her. She speaks ina low, but harsh voice.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: I knew it. As soon as I saw you, I knew it. What was happening with you.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: What was happening to me, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: You think of a man. Do not deny it. I know it. Agnes looks up at her, wide eyed. MOTHER SUPERIOR (cont’d) Don’t tell me anything. We do not talk of these things, here. Agnes gets up and throws the water to wash off the foam o the ground. Mother Superior approaches her, and stares in her eyes. MOTHER SUPERIOR (cont’d) When you came here, you brought your body and your soul with you. Right? She speaks with passion, and tears appear in her eyes, whereas Agnes looks frozen. Silence. MOTHER SUPERIOR (cont‘d) Right?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Yes, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: But you cannot keep them both now. You have to decide which one to give up. Right?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Yes, Mother. There is a silence, but Agnes doesn’t seem overwhelmed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20  s.18 p.21. AGNES (cont’d) Is it true that an army is coming from Istanbul, to cover Albanian women with veils?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: Who told you this?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: My father. He told me that they are going to cover us all, from head to toe, like their wives... Mother Superior interrupts her with a sharp voice.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER SUPERIOR
dialogues.text: No, this is not true. Only God’s will shall prevail. Agnes remains apparently shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan’s detachment of fifteen warriors has stopped at another mountain pass. A sign has been put there, which reads: REPUBLIC OF KORCA. FRENCH PROTECTORATE. Shestan signals everybody to stop.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: The French don’t seem to be far

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Shsh! Let’s listen for a while, just in case there’s any fighting going on! They stop dead in their tracks and turn their heads: sile Doské grabs Shestan’s arm. SHESTAN (cont’d) What now?

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: These French, are they with us, or against us?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: How should I know? They walk a little more and discover at the top of the sl a French military outpost. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21  s.19 p.22. They are stunned by all the flags they suddenly see: - Gr Britain’s, France’s, Germany’s, Italy’s and The Austro- Hungarian Empire’s - hoisted on a rectangular metallic structure. The flags dance wildly under the wind. The place is guarded by armed soldiers, wearing the Frenc army uniform. They look alert. Shestan waves at them. SHESTAN (cont’d) Don’t shoot! What kind of flags are these?

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: The first one is British, captain. The second Austrian, the third Italian, and the rest, I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: And our flag, how come it isn’t shown?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you ask them, captain?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Who the heck is going to talk to them?

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Let me do it, captain. He approaches the guards, who point their weapons at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH GUARDS
dialogues.text: Arrétez-vous! Doské stops dead in his tracks. The fighters ready their weapons. Doské talks to them aloud:

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Albania?.. Flag, flag, Albania! The guards do not reply. Doské points at the flags and repeats his words. DOSKE (cont’d) The flag, where? The flag?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Forget it, Doské. They do not understand. Ask them about the war. Use that word of yours.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: War, war! Where? War, war? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22  20 s.19 p.23. Doské accompanies his words with ample gestures, opening arms and pointing with his finger all around.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: No war, no war!

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: War, War! Bang, bang! He imitates the sound of a shooting weapon. The guards do understand. One of them produces a whistle and blows hard The other one does the same. Shestan and his men do not understand. By now all the guards are blowing their whist

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Let’s go, captain! It doesn’t look good. They’re getting nervous. Their whole army will soon be on us!

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Let’s go, then. The fighters trot away, as the guards keep blowing their whistles all around the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village square. Empty. The door of the mosque is open None of the village inhabitants is around. Carts and plou can be seen scattered all around. The fighters quench the thirst at the stone fountain, and fill up their gourds.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Look! They surrender! I swear to God, they are coming here to surrender! Two men dressed with a French army uniform, enter the vil square. One of them holds a white flag. Shestan frowns. T Frenchmen come close and give the military salute. Nobody replies. One of the Frenchmen starts speaking a bad Alban

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FRENCHMAN
dialogues.text: Where is commander?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST FRENCHMAN
dialogues.text: French commander wants to meet Albanian commander. Shestan looks at his companions, but doesn’t say a word. French give the military salute and leave. 23  21 s.21 p.24. EXT. FRENCH COMMANDER’S TENT. DAY. 21 Shestan, Doské, and Cute have stopped in front of the Fre commander’s tent in the shade of a couple of tall trees. French commander is patronizing them, by smoking a long cigar. He turns to his interpreter, but Shestan interrupt him.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Whose side are you on? His words are translated into French.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Pardon me?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: I asked: whose side are you on? The French commander clears his voice, to make the whole thing appear very formal and serious.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: He seems such an asshole to me. The French commander turns to his interpreter, but the interpreter seems to have trouble making out Cute’s words just shakes his head reproachfully.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Let’s be frank to each other. France’s wish is that the situation in the Balkans be stabilized, that’s why we are here. Do you really believe that the Austrian-Hungarian Empire is a friend and protector of your country’s interests? I know you cannot believe such a thing. The truth is that they have their own interests to pursue, and you legendary commander, should avoid falling into this trap! You must also rest assured that France’s policy, with regards to...

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Enough already! He puts his hand on his gun. Everybody freezes. The Frenc Commander keeps talking with the shade of a smile on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: It’s such a pity that we cannot find a common ground so that we can proceed with our talks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24  s.21 p.25. FRENCH COMMANDER(cont'd) I consider your presence, dear commander, as an expression of our efforts, yours and mine, to... As the French interpreter is translating, Shestan pulls o the map and shows it to the Frenchman.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Do you know what this is? The interpreter translates.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: It’s a map of the Ottoman Empire.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: This is Albania. We are right here. You get it?

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: If you allow me, dear captain, I’l1l show you now my map. The one that you have isn’t worth anything anymore. He enters the tent and soon comes out with a map of Europ He points at the tiny Albania on the map. FRENCH COMMANDER (cont’d) This is your country. Right here. Shestan and Cute Benja bend over to the tiny spot on the They are incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What? Jeez, that small!? The French commander shrugs. Cute hits the ground with hi shoe. Cute (cont'd) You think Albania is as small as my shoe? Fuck you! He marks his shoe around as to make a map of Albania.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Keep it if you want. I have another one. The interpreter translates with a silly grin. The French commander hands Shestan the map. Shestan stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Don’t, captain! Don’t accept it! Let him keep that piece of trash to himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Don’t accept it, captain. The French guy’s playing a trick on us. Shestan tears the map, throws the pieces on the ground, a turns his back on the French officer. Shestan, Doské and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: You know, it’s not by accident that France’s notorious for being such a harlot... They walk away as the French commander resumes pacing in front of his tent, pulling on his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan’s men are all asleep, but he his awake watching t stars in the sky. A shooting star. Shestan is in love. St up and has a look all around. Silence. He sits by the fir Rolls a cigarette. He looks at the stars. Another shootin star. Alush comes to Shestan.

dialogues.speaker: ALUSH
dialogues.text: What a nice place for a grave!

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Looking for a place of yours? Alush nods. Shestan smiles. SHESTAN (cont’d) Have a look! It’s so beautiful, for God’s sake! Isn’t that magnificent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of four nuns, carrying wood, is walking towards t convent, along a muddy road. Agnes is heavily loaded. In front of her the Skinny Nun breathes heavily. Two horseme gallop pass them. Agnes watches them as they ride away. T Skinny Nun next to her nudges her.

dialogues.speaker: SKINNY NUN
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind? Don’t look at men like that! Do you get it? Agnes looks through her, lost in her thoughts. The nuns k walking. Agnes drops her burden down and turns around. Th horsemen have disappeared. The Skinny Nun looks back, Agn stands still on the road. Skinny Nun stops, Agnes doesn’t move. SKINNY NUN (cont‘d) Come on! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26  24 25 $.23 p.27. Agnes takes her burden back on her shoulders. The Skinny follows the others. Agnes stays behind, looks around. The nuns disappear on the top of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan Verdha’s detachment has stopped at some distance the inn, where "LONG LIVE KING WIED" is written on the wa Cute Benja, dressed up like a mullah - a Moslem priest - comes back from the inn, out of breath, and reports what saw. He looks ridiculous in his costume.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Captain, there are King Wied’s Army formations preceding us. At the Two Roberts Inn I met two Dutch officers. They were drinking wine and speaking Dutch. I swear to God!

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Okay, now take those clothes off! Cute Benja starts undressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The column of fighters, with the King’s flag, is passing “Two Roberts” Inn. The haystacks, wet with rain, glimmer under the setting sun. Upturned carts here and there. All around the corn granaries, chicken are fumbling the groun for corn, and fires are burning in the fields with a lot smoke. No sound comes from the inn.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What a strange silence... He has hardly sais that when gunfire explodes from the haystacks, the granaries, and the fences. Two fighters on Shestan’s flank fall. Shestan tries to look through the binoculars, but they get hit by a bullet and fly off his hands. He yells at his companions, who are attacking on t own mind. SHESTAN (cont’d) Get back! Get back! Nobody listens. Doské curses the enemy, touching his ball

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Where are you, motherfuckers? Where are your sisters, I am asking you?! A hail of bullets prey upon them. Shestan is losing blood from the scratch wound on his hand. Cute Benja runs towar the haystacks; he tries to set fire to them, but fails. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: The haystacks are wet, damn it! Otherwise I would have burned the motherfuckers alive, like rats. Now they are all lying down and shooting in the direction the rebels’ gunfire. The mule pulling the cart with the c is whining, as it tries to free itself. Cute has finally fire to two haystacks, from which two rebels try to escap running like hell. Shestan and Doské shoot at the same ti but the rebels escape in the smoke. CUTE (cont’d) Captain! Captain! This is an ambush! Flat on the ground, Shestan cannot believe Cute is saying such nonsense in such a moment, with bullets whizzing everywhere. Doské has dragged himself close to one of the haystacks, and he shoots at it. Someone screams in pain f inside. Doské stabs the haystack with his bayonet. The re inside screams again, with a horrible voice:

dialogues.speaker: REBEL
dialogues.text: Death to all Infidels! Allah uakhbarr ! Stunned and smeared with blood, one of Shestan’s warriors comes running out of the smoke. Two bullets hit him in th legs, bringing him down. He cries out, tears running down cheeks: SHESTAN’S WARRIOR Long live Albania! Glory to the cross! Go git them, my friends! He can’t get up back on his feet. Doské jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Let’s go get them, brothers! Let’s go fuck their mothers right now! Kus Babaj, the leader of the Muslim rebels, is following battle through his binoculars. He spots Shestan Verdha’s handsome figure, running gun in hand. [POV through binoculars] Kus Babaj admires Shestan Verdha beauty. He orders two rebels.

dialogues.speaker: KUS BABAJ
dialogues.text: I want him alive. Allah’s made him by His own hand! Such a pretty boy! An angel! The two rebels, dressed in baggy pants, go crawling towar Shestan, to get him alive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28  s.25 p.29. But the wind turns, the haystacks flare up, and the two rebels are suddenly surrounded by smoke. They start cough and have to run away from the incoming flames. They final make it through the smoke, but only to face Cute’s and Doské’s guns. The two rebels are shot down. One of them manages to say a few words, with his throat torn in half:

dialogues.speaker: WOUNDED REBEL
dialogues.text: Fuck Jesus Christ and your faggot king from Germany! Doské stabs him in the belly with his bayonet. The rebel moans. Doské yells at him.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: You fucking moron, I am a Muslim too, but I don’t insult no Jesus no Mohamet and no King! Shame on you!

dialogues.speaker: WOUNDED REBEL
dialogues.text: You don’t have the balls, that’s why!

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: I don’t have the balls?! Why don’t you pick up your stinking bowels instead of leaking your crap all around? The wounded rebel tries to show off with a smile between pain convulsions, until he falls to the ground, dead, wit his belly open. Shestan’s fighters charge. A red-light flares up in the s Kus Babaj motions his people to move back. A fighter runs between two haystacks and is about to set fire to them, w rebel bullets hit him through the smoke. He falls on his back. A hand comes out of the smoke, grabs his binoculars vanishes. Someone brings Kus Babaj the binoculars looted from the fallen fighter. Kus Babaj hangs them around his neck, and then they all disappear from sight. There’s still fightin going on in the inn. One of Shestan’s fighters chases a b panted rebel until he gets him cornered by the well, wher they both try to impale each other with their bayonet whi talking trash:

dialogues.speaker: REBEL
dialogues.text: You, infidel swine! You faithless louse! May Allah strike you dead! SHESTAN’S FIGHTER You gypsy motherfucker... You shithole! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29  26 s.25 p.30. Cute Benja continues to crawl, setting fire to the haysta Thick smoke is everywhere. The rebels are heard screaming chorus, as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: REBELS
dialogues.text: (screams ) Allah-u akhbari! Allah-u akhbar EXT. THE “TWO ROBERTS INN”. NIGHTFALL. 26 The area surrounding the inn is still lit up by the many haystacks still burning through the smoke. Shestan’s detachment surround Cute Benja, who’s talking and crying the same time.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: It’s my fault, I ruined everything. Because of those demons in the inn - they were speaking Dutch, I swear to God! Doské puts the barrel of his gun against Cute’s heart. Shestan stops him.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: No, Doské, no! It’s not his fault if he doesn’t understand Dutch. How could he know they were Kus Babaj’s men, dressed up like Dutch officers? Take that gun away! They all stand, tense. Cute Benja starts crying again.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Maybe so! But he should know he knows nothing in Dutch! Didn’t he tell us they were Dutch officers?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Because they were speaking an unknown language. The kind of answer that makes Doské mad.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: There! That’s what’s wrong with him!

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Don’t kill me, brothers! I have nine mouths to feed! Please, let me go back see them, tell them a couple of things once and for all, then I’1l1 come back and you can do whatever you want... Shestan grabs Doské’s hand and pushes the gun away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you just fuck off and never come back, you son of a bitch! Shestan gives him an angry look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnes walks on the road, dressed as a nun. In the distanc she sees some soldiers coming her way. She immediately hi behind a stone wall. She hears them singing in Ukrainian: they are drunk. They come near the wall and one of them s to have seen her, but he only throws an empty bottle agai the wall. The others want to do the same, but one of them puts his bottle on the wall, and walks back fifteen meter He shoots at it with his rifle. The bottle explodes. They laugh. Agnes is terrified. Now the dozen of them does the same and the soldiers shoot at the bottles. They are drun and miss. Some bullets clash in the wall. The bottles explode. Agnes huddles up while splinters of glass fall a over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan and his men are walking to the river. Shestan tur and sees Cute Benja following them in the distance. Shest and his men stop, Cute Benja stops too. Shestan signals t resume walking.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Let him do what he wants. Don’t talk to him. All of a sudden, they hear screaming in their backs: a horserider appears in a cloud of dust holding a Turkish r flag and riding a magnificent white stallion. He is a kid fifteen, screaming and riding like crazy. Shestan and his pull aside to let him pass. Sefer, the young horserider, stops, turns his horse around and comes back to them.

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: Hey men, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: To fight.

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: I am Sefer. I am going to fight, too. I will join Kus Babaj. He is the greatest warrior, a man of God. And who are you fighting for ?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: For the king. Sefer looks confused. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: What king are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: The king of Albania, little boy !

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: Look, I am not a boy. I ama fighter and a thief ! You see this? He pats the white stallion’s neck. SEFER (cont’d) It’s for Kus Babaj. I stole it just for him. See, what a beauty! Kus Babaj loves horses and boys like me. Sefer is hardly holding the horse which bucks on his hind legs. Shestan comes to him.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Listen, man. Why don’t you bring the horse back and go home? Sefer smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: Home? No, no. I am going to fight. You will hear about me ! Silence. SEFER (cont’d) You got bread ? Doske throws him a piece. Sefer catches it and bites in i He pulls the rope, hits the horse, and gallops away, screaming and waving the red Turkish flag. SEFER (cont’d) Long Live Kus Babaj! Long Live the Sultan, I am going to war ! Shestan and his men look distraught. They reach the river dive into the water. While they are swimming and washing their clothes, Cute stays at some distance on the bank, a cries. All of a sudden, Doske, Tod and Alush grab Cute and throw naked in the river. At first Cute is afraid they might dr him, then everybody laughs at him. He’s forgiven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logs burning in the fireplace. Kus Babaj is wearing the t pair of binoculars around his neck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32  s.29 p.33. Some thirty of his people are there, drinking raki, and s of them, already drunk, are singing. Dervishes, all in wh prance around, busy with their rites. All of a sudden, on the drunkards goes into a trance and stands up, holding a meat chunk in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: TUG OSMANI
dialogues.text: I am Tug Osmani, Kus Babaj! May you live as long as the mountains, may Allah look after you! He throws the meat chunk into the fire. Then he starts cr a river. TUG OSMANI (cont’d) I want to be roasted for the Bayram sacrifice! Then, suddenly, he throws himself into the fire. The dervishes rush to take him out, but he is too strong, he resists and goes back into the flames, screaming out of p because of the burns. TUG OSMANI (cont’d) Please, don’t remove me from the fire, I need to roast a little bit more, I am not done enough. I don’t want to be hard under Kus Babaj’s teeth when he’1l have me for dinner tonight! I want to sacrifice myself this very evening, in the name of Allah! Everybody is around this man gone berserk, covered with b wounds all over face and body, crying and screaming. He t one last time to get into the fire, but four men manage t master him and tie him up. Kus Babaj sighs out of grief. Shaqir Ali, a dervish, rais his glass. Kus Babaj follows the same with a glum reflect in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: SHAQIR ALI
dialogues.text: God bless you, Kus Babaj, because you bring light to this house! We learned about what happened to your lover boy Vasilakis, it was such a sad thing, but what can one do about it? It was written your heart be filled with grief in your old age. Lover boys should have their face covered just like ladies, to avoid disasters; because love cannot be kept in jail, and where love is, a dagger is not far. Kus Babaj stares at the flames,his head down. One of the guards starts singing with a wailing voice: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33  Kus Babaj, s.29 p.34.

dialogues.speaker: SINGER
dialogues.text: 6 Hassan Zyber, you killed my lover boy, Even if you had seven souls, I’11 tear them all from you. You cast a shadow and darkened my old age, Why should this disgrace fall upon me, now an old man? Even if you had seven souls, I’11 tear them all from you.” with tears in his eyes, turns to him:

dialogues.speaker: KUS BABAJ
dialogues.text: Thank you. God bless you! Kus Babaj changes the conversation. KUS BABAJ (cont'd) We sent a letter to this German King - or a “memorandum” as the infidels call it. Have you heard of this? KUS BABAJ’S MEN (around him) No, never heard anything, Kus Babaj. Tell us!

dialogues.speaker: KUS BABAJ
dialogues.text: We wrote King Wied that we accept him for our King and master, on one condition only: that he gets circumcised. Everybody bursts out laughing. KUS BABAJ (cont'd) And now we’re waiting for his reply.

dialogues.speaker: SHAQIR ALI
dialogues.text: Kus Babaj, the King may agree to it, but will queen Sophia also agree? Will she like the king to screw her with that kind of tool? Everybody laughs. Kus Babaj raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KUS BABAJ
dialogues.text: God bless you, my boys. Don’t worry: Albania and Turkey are like nail and flesh, they can’t be separated. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 34  30 KUS BABA\J(cont'd) See, Great Allah already placed his sign of warning in the sky, this comet, shaped like a broom. Everyone nods. EXT. PLACE KNOWN AS "THE THREE GRAVES" .DAY. s.29 p.35. 30 It is raining. Three representatives of the Austrian army show up for talks with Shestan’s fighters with a white fl The Austrians give him the military salute. Shestan lets know, with a hand gesture, that he wants to speak first.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Does Austria really care for Albania, or is it that she’s pursuing her own interests in this jumble? The Austrian officer speaks in Albanian.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRIAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: You should know, Herr Kapitan, that pathetic terms such as "care" lose their intrinsic value, when relations between states are concerned.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: That’s enough! I understand. Don’t want to hear any more. The officer stares at Shestan.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRIAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: I have heard about you, Herr Kapitan. Still, the idea I had was somewhat different...

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What you think isn’t my business.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: He’s lying, captain. He just wants to fool us.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRIAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: May I ask you why this place is called "The Three Graves"? Shestan answers with a coarse voice.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: I’1l tell you why: one of the graves is mine, the other is yours and the third is waiting for whoever is going to be buried there a hundred years from now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35  31 s.30 p.36. The officer remains stunned. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRIAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: You speak like a philosopher, Herr Kapitan. Very well said indeed! The Austrians salute and leave. Doské, Cute and the other surround Shestan and pat him on the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan Verdha, Doské and Cute Benja, gun on shoulder, st in front of a shop displaying a carelessly put up sign: QUAZIM’S BARBER’S SHOP The shop is closed. Shestan looks through the window. Nobody’s there.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: It’s closed.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: I can see it’s closed. Shestan approaches the door on which is written: « I AM AT THE KING’S »

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: The barber is at the King’s. This is what it says.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: At the King’s? What the hell is he doing there?! Nobody talks, Shestan moves away. Suddenly Cute shows his to Doské. CUTE (cont’d) You know what? I swear to Allah he’s gone to circumcise the King!

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Come on, why should the barber go see the King? What else could he be doing there? You tell me. Doske looks thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Maybe you’re right. The King, of course, knows how to shave. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Of course, he knows how to shave. He’s German! You get it? It’s over we’re going home soon! He turns to Shestan, but he is nowhere to be seen. CUTE (cont’d) Captain Shestan! It’s over! The war is over! Hey, Shestan, the King has been circumcised! He runs away shouting. Doské follows him, ashamed of Cute shouting and dancing on the street: CUTE (cont’d) Circumcised! Circumcised! King Wied has been circumcised! Doské acts as if he’s never known him;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan stands in front of a shop displaying wedding dres Suddenly, Cute Benja appears at the street corner, runnin and shouting:

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Captain, it’s done! The King has been circumcised!

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! Shestan stops Cute by putting his palm on his mouth. SHESTAN (cont’d) Can’t you ever shut up! INT. BARBER’S SHOP. DAY. 33 The barber is shaving Shestan. Many men have already gath in the shop. The barber is telling his story with a loud voice, his eyes glittering with happiness. Everyone liste with fascination.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Here, see, the king’s whiskers they were this long. The barber makes a gesture with his hands half meter wide BARBER (cont’d) Handsome, blue eyed. A real gentleman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37  34 s.33 p.38. BARBER(cont'd) Not to mention his clothes. Diamonds and gold, shining like a mirror!

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Listen, why don’t you tell us what you were doing there? What’s your business with the king? Is he a relative of yours, or what?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? My brother works at the royal stables and his Majesty is very fond of him. So, one day, he told the king that his brother - me - would very much like to shave Him - free of charge, of course - as often as he wishes. And the king didn’t say no, obviously.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Cute, let him tell us what the king told him.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: As I was lathering his cheeks, he began to tell me... [Dissolve to the king’s apartments, as the barber continu his story in voiceover. ] INT. KING’S PALACE. PRIVATE APARTMENT. DAY. 34 In the middle of a very big room, the barber is lathering king’s face helped by his young son as an assistant, hold the towel and the hot water basin. The boy is constantly smiling.

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: Do you believe in God, good man?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Don’t know how to put it, your Majesty. I do and I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: What does this mean?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: This is rather tricky thing, your Majesty. Can’t find the right words to explain it.

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: Why is it so tricky? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: How could I put it? I am just a barber, I shave people’s cheeks. Religion is no topic for people like me. The king looks at him in the mirror, silent for a while.

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: Are you a Muslim?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: My father’s a Muslim, my mother’s a Christian. I am both.

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: Is that so?! How interesting!

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Yes, your Majesty. In this country nobody makes a big deal of religion. Sometimes people from different religions they marry.

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: That’s pretty interesting.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: What about you, your majesty? Are you a Christian?

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: I am a Protestant. The barber doesn’t seem to understand. KING WIED (cont’d) May I ask you something personal?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Anything you want, your Majesty!

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: Are you circumcised?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Of course I am, your Majesty. Everybody is. My son too. The barber laughs. BARBER (cont’d) Circumcision isn’t common in your parts ..if I may say so. Is it your Majesty? The King doesn’t react. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Well, that’s how the world is. And you’ve never seen one, right?

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: No. Not really. Why?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: You can have a look at my son’s, here. If you want, that is. I mean, if it’s not too embarrassing for you. The King doesn’t answer BARBER (cont’d) He wouldn’t care much. He understands, he’s a smart little boy. King Wied smiles. The barber lowers the boy’s pants, and pushes him closer to the king.

dialogues.speaker: KING WIED
dialogues.text: Oh, no}... The little boy who still has the water basin in his hands keeps smiling like a simpleton. The barber fumbles with h son’s penis. Then he pulls the pants up, and ties them wi the drawstring.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: That’s good luck for my boy, your Majesty: the king of Albania’s seen his circumcised pistol. The King looks stunned. [Dissolve back to the barber’s shop, where the barber is shaving Shestan, and telling his story] INT. BARBER’S SHOP. DAY. 35 Everyone is laughing out loud. The barber’s young son joi them. The barber works slowly, and looks solemn all of a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: Did you hear about this? They’ve sent a letter to the king, asking him to get circumcised! Everybody is listening. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: How do you know? Who sent this letter?

dialogues.speaker: BARBER
dialogues.text: What do I know?! But if he refuses there’s going to be war. And that’s bad news for everybody.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Well, what’s the big deal? Let him get cut. Only good comes from it. It’s healthy, and sanitary.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Shut up, Cute! Easier said than done. The king knows what to do anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Well, you can’t be so sure. Silence falls. The barber wipes off Shestan’s face. The muezzin’s song is heard “Allah uakhbarr, Allah uakhbarrr” People leave the barber’s shop and head for the mosque. O Shestan, Cute Benja, Doské and the barber remain inside. barber is taking his apron off. Shestan produces a coin a hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan’s warriors walk. The moon rises in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: The moon.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: I can see it.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Yes, but I mean isn't it strange how the moon shines over the earth?

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: What’s so strange about it? It's like that. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Easy to say...

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Shut up and keep walking in silence. We don't know what's around us. They march. 41  37 s.37 p.42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters carefully approach the ruins of an abandoned village. Nobody seems to be there. Cute walks to the well

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: I swear to God this water is not poisoned. They all look at each other

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You’re getting more and more stupid everyday. Do you realize that?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: No. Why?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Shh... Quiet! All three of them cock their guns. They take a cautious s forward. SHESTAN (cont’d) Who’s there? They step back and take cover behind the well. They hear little noise. SHESTAN (cont’d) Come out! Nothing moves. SHESTAN (cont'd) Come out! We are friends! Agnes very slowly appears. She is still in her nun’s clot but they are torn and ruined. She looks destroyed. Her headdress is gone. She is crying, terrified. Cute lets th bucket fall down the well.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Please don’t hurt me, don’t hurt me...

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What? He lowers his gun and realizes he is facing Agnes. She ha dark rings under her terrified eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: I haven’t slept since... three days ago.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Nobody’s going to hurt you. You’re alright. Agnes doesn’t trust them, and stays behind the well. SHESTAN (cont’d) Are you alone?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Have anything to eat? Cute Benja gives her some bread. Shestan comes to her, ta her gently by the hand, and has her sit down on a rock. A cries.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Why don’t you eat something first?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Who did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: The soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What soldiers?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Don’t know what soldiers. Couldn’t make out the language.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Cut the crap, Cute. Let her eat. Agnes looks up at Shestan with hope.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What do we do with her, captain?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: She comes with us.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Why? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Why do you always ask questions? Agnes chews the bread trembling with fear. She raises her beautiful eyes, and looks at Shestan. Cute fills the flas with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shestan’s fighters and Agnes march. It is raining. Shesta takes off his cape and gives it to Agnes who’s shivering the cold.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Agnes.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Agnes, you remember me? We met at the bridge, with your father. Agnes doesn’t answer. SHESTAN (cont’d) I am Shestan. From the village of Mokér, in the south... Agnes is mute. SHESTAN (cont’d) We shall have to go to the convent and leave you there. It’s the only safe place. It’s not too far. When the war is over, you can go back home. Agnes shakes her head in despair

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: I left the convent, and I cannot go home.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: I’m scared. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Scared of whom?

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: My father... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44  39 s.38 p.45. Shestan looks at her. AGNES (cont’d) He will know. She cries and falls on her knees. AGNES (cont'd) He’s going to kill me, if I go back home.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Did you hear this? She can’t go back home.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: You mean, since she’s been raped...

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: (interrupting harshly) Yes, Cute. Yes. It’s like that. Shestan, Doské and Cute Benja feel awkward.

dialogues.speaker: AGNES
dialogues.text: Take me with you. They all fall silent. AGNES (cont’d) I know how to shoot! The three fighters are surprised by Agnes’ sudden claim.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: No. You’11 stay with the nuns. We’re heading for war. Agnes grabs him by the sleeve. Shestan pulls off, and wal away through the rain. Agnes follows.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: But I don’t understand why...

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Shut up. EXT. MUSLIM REBELS’ ENCAMPMENT. DAY. 39 Kus Babaj’s rebels’ encampment near a village with mosque Kus Babaj rides his beautiful white Arab stallion. He pet the horse with affection. Sefer looks at him in admiratio gnawing at a piece of corn on the cob. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KUS BABAJ
dialogues.text: That a boy! You made me so happy! Sefer grins proudly and trustfully. KUS BABAJ (cont'd) Listen to me now. I’m going to ask you for a special favor. Tonight at midnight you’1l have to hide yourself somewhere close to the King’s palace. No one must see you is that clear? You will have to stay hidden until the clock strikes twelve. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KUS BABAJ
dialogues.text: You can use your fingers, so that you can’t go wrong. Finish one hand first, then the other, then the two thumbs. All together make twelve. If you mess this up, we’re going to hang you by your feet. Sefer keeps grinning like an idiot, too proud of his miss and his trust for Kus Babaj. KUS BABAJ (cont'd) This is not a game. It can cost you your skin, you know what I mean? Sefer nods.

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KUS BABAJ
dialogues.text: Very well, Sefer, you’11 count four cannon shots. There won’t be a fifth. when you have counted four run like hell. I’11 give you the money myself tomorrow. Go break a leg now. Sefer bows to Kus Babaj and rides away through the dust. Drums can be heard. EXT. THE KING’S PALACE. NIGHT. 40 Munching some bread Sefer walks up the hill where king Wi palace stands. He stops dead in his track when he spots t Dutch guards. He climbs the wall silently, the guards fai notice him. He pulls out the torch and the lighter (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: The queen sleeps here. She’s white like a snowflake, they say. She bathes in milk all day long, and then she makes love all night. She’s a nymph, that’s what she is. EXT. THE KING’S PALACE. NIGHT. 41 The clock of the palace strikes twelve. Sefer is finishin counting his fingers. He lights up the torch, and starts waving it above his head. No shot is heard.

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: May God help me with this! The torch flames fly wild under the wind. EXT. MUSLIM REBELS’ ENCAMPMENT. NIGHT. 42 A turbaned gunner fires his canon in a thunder. EXT. THE KING’S PALACE. NIGHT. 43 The shell is heard whistling through the sky. Sefer close his eyes. He keeps waving the torch for the far away gunn to aim at. There is an explosion behind his back. He open his eyes, scared to death. Sefer hears the Dutch guards shouting. He keeps waving th torch, as the second shot hits closer. He closes his ear the palm of his hand. He waves the torch again.

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: Why delay the third shot? Is there anything wrong with the canon? Damn, my arm is all numb now. Wait a minute: there goes the thundering... then the whistling, it’s coming... The incoming shell makes a horrible shrilling noise. Sefe gapes at it but holds his torch firmly. The shell explode behind him. EXT. MUSLIM REBELS’ ENCAMPMENT. NIGHT. 44 The canon fires once again. EXT. THE KING’S PALACE. NIGHT. 45 Another cannonball is heard slicing through the night air now comes straight at Sefer, as if guided by the torch. S shouts out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SEFER
dialogues.text: I am here, come to me! He laughs. [Special effects] Through Sefer’s eyes, we see the shell towards us. Hit by the shell, Sefer’s body flies away in pieces. The torch flies away as well, like a comet and hi the ground in sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foggy day. Shestan’s detachment crosses a furious river. Agnes follows Shestan holding his cape. On the opposite b a sign has been posted, written both in Latin and Greek script:

dialogues.speaker: SEPARATIST ORTHODOX PRINCEDOM OF NORTHERN EPIRUS
dialogues.text: Shestan reads it out aloud.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: It says “The Separatist Orthodox Princedom of Northern Epirus”. What’s wrong with these people?! He brings the sign down and throws it in the river. Shest opens the wrinkled map, straightens it out and places it his knees. He starts marking with a pencil the road they covered already. They gather around him.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: We’ve done a lot of walking, damn it. Shestan draws a line on the map pointing north-east.

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: Captain, I’m afraid this place here is Macedonia.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: Here, look: it reads “Ohrid”, and there: “Skopje”. And these are the lakes. Here you have the villages with Albanian names, and there those with Slav names. We’re in the wrong place. We had better go back. They start looking around.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? we haven’t seen any Macedonian so far. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: He’s right. Haven’t seen any of those. Just go ahead, captain, and draw your line, because this is still our land. Shestan hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute. This is Kosovo and this is Serbia, and I have Albania here, Greece is there, and this place here, you think it’s Macedonia, right?

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: I’ve been in Skopje myself, two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: And how was it?

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: People all over the place; stores, mosques, churches; just like here.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Can’t be just like here.

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: I swear, it was just like here. Only the language was different.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Any Albanian there?

dialogues.speaker: TOD
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Good people? They all look at Cute disapprovingly.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: There can’t be any bad Albanians for God’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Of course not! With a pencil, Shestan circles the Albanian territories o the Turkish map. Then, he crumples it and tucks it in his belt. Starts rolling a cigarette. Agnes is asleep. Shesta covers her with his cape. She wakes up, and stares at Shestan, with fearful eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Sleep now. The fighters smoke and stay silent. Shestan goes under a to rest. Cute Benja smiles and chats with Doské.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: It’s so weird, Doské, sometimes I don’t even know what I’m talking about. Have you noticed that?

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: That’s odd, ‘cause LI...

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Without thinking. I do that sometimes. But you know, what’s important is what we do; what we do we do is what we are.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: Doské, you know what I miss most? I miss a piece of warm pie so much... My wife can cook it so well, you wouldn’t believe. I won’t give up the ghost till I’ve had a real meal one last time: a cheese and onion pie, and a bowl of thin yoghurt, and then a nice little nap by the fireplace. Nothing can beat that.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Cute, for God’s sake, why are you telling me all this about a cheese pie? Can’t think of anything else?

dialogues.speaker: CUTE
dialogues.text: And you know what I miss too? Doské sighs. CUTE (cont’d) A wedding party. Just imagine if we had a wedding party. Everyone dancing: first the men. Just think of those women dancing. You just have to look at one of them. Goose pimples all over.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Is that what you call it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50  s.46 p.51. Murmur of water from the river and birds chirping in the trees. One of the fighters produces a clarinet and starts playing a famous tune. Cute Benja and Shestan are dancing Other fighters join in, until the dance becomes really hu with about thirty people in quilts, hanging on from each other’s shoulders, jumping up and down and screaming like wild beasts out of pleasure. Agnes wakes up, startled. Sh sees the men dancing. She keeps her eyes trained on Shest handsome face. While everyone is dancing, a group of people wearing different clothes sneaks in the back. These are Macedonia peasants, armed with rifles and hay forks. Nobody notices them. They stop at a short distance from Shestan’s fighte They wave their hands in order to attract the dancers’ attention, but in vain. Finally, the Macedonians shoot th weapons in the air. The Albanian fighters freeze and look around. Nobody has been hit. The two sides stare at each other, challengingly.

dialogues.speaker: MACEDONIAN PEASANT
dialogues.text: (in Macedonian) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Who are you? None of the Macedonians replies. CUTE (cont’d) (in Albanian) It looks like we have trespassed on the goddamned Macedonian territory! Both sides remain silent.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Don’t shoot. Just stay calm. He starts to walk towards the Macedonians. Doské follows in order to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: DOSKE
dialogues.text: Don’t get any closer, captain. They are armed.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Stay where you are. I can talk to them. Shestan walks towards the Macedonians. They wait for him. Shestan’s people stay ready for combat. Shestan stops in front of the Macedonians. (a1) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MACEDONIAN PEASANT
dialogues.text: This is Macedonia. What’s your business here?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: We lost our way. The map confused us. Now we are going back. My men were dancing to shed off the fatigue. The Macedonians whisper to each other. Shestan’s fighters inching closer on their guard. The Macedonian peasants li to him in silence, still unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: MACEDONIAN PEASANT
dialogues.text: We thought you were preparing for a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Wedding? No, oh yes, but my men just love to rehearse before the wedding. We are expecting the best dancers.

dialogues.speaker: MACEDONIAN PEASANT
dialogues.text: Mmm, mmm. What kind of music is that?

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: MACEDONIAN PEASANT
dialogues.text: ‘Cause we know these tunes, too. But we play them properly, much better than you do.

dialogues.speaker: SHESTAN
dialogues.text: Well, that’s why we’re neighbors. Divided by a river. He offers the Macedonian his tobacco pouch. SHESTAN (cont’d) Here, roll a cigarette. The Macedonian hesitates, looks around. Doské and Cute ha taken out their own tobacco pouches. One of the Macedonia accepts the offer, with words of gratitude. Everyone else follows. The sight of these scores of men smoking evokes feeling of peace. The Macedonian is now staring at Agnes. turns to Shestan.

dialogues.speaker: MACEDONIAN PEASANT
dialogues.text: That girl over there.. do you use her for fun? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
